required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Myocardial Stiffness Using Elastometry in Patients With Aortic Stenosis
clinical_study.official_title: Epicardial Measurement of Myocardial Stiffness on Beating Heart and Non-beating Heart During a Programmed Surgical Aortic Valve Replacement for Aortic Stenosis

brief_summary.textblock:
Elastography is a new non-invasive medical technique for measuring the stiffness at a distance from a tissue. Recent advances in the development of elastography sequences for cardiac exploration suggest a more clinical approach to cardiac elastography. This study propose to compare myocardial stiffness of a group of coronary bypass patients without hypertrophic left ventricular remodeling or sequelae of myocardial infarction versus a group of patients who should benefit from a surgical aortic valve replacement for aortic stenosis.
The hypothesis is that the physiological adaptation to pressure overload constituted by aortic stenosis is responsible for a significant increase in myocardial stiffness compared to a reference group.

primary_outcome.measure: to compare myocardial stiffness by ShearWave elastography on not beating heart in two groups of patients referred for surgery
primary_outcome.description: The main outcome measure is evaluated by ShearWave elastography with the measurement of Young modulus on non-beating heart

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the diastolic myocardial stiffness of the beating heart with the myocardial stiffness of the non-beating heart
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure is evaluated by ShearWave elastography with the measurement of Young modulus on non-beating heart

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare epicardial and trans-thoracic diastolic myocardial stiffness
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure is evaluated by elastography using the measurement of Young modulus in epicardial (using the linear probe) and transthoracic (using the scanning probe).

secondary_outcome.measure: To search a statistical link between the diastolic myocardial stiffness of the beating heart and the non-beating heart with conventional diastolic indices
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure is evaluated: by ShearWave elastography with the measurement of Young modulus on non-beating heart by conventional ultrasound criteria (peak e', peak E, volume of the left atrium calculated by simpson biplanes, maximum velocity of tricuspid insufficiency).

secondary_outcome.measure: To search a statistical link between the diastolic myocardial stiffness of the beating heart and the non-beating heart with heart failure parameters
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure is evaluated: by ShearWave elastography with the measurement of Young modulus on non-beating heart by heart failure parameters defined by NYHA class, the walking test and the BNP assay

secondary_outcome.measure: To search a statistical link between the diastolic myocardial stiffness of the beating heart and the non-beating heart with left ventricular mass indexed to the body surface
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure is evaluated: by ShearWave elastography with the measurement of Young modulus on non-beating heart by LV mass indexed to the body surface calculated by the cardiac mass measuring by ultrasound indexed to the body surface

secondary_outcome.measure: To analyze the link between the diastolic myocardial stiffness of the beating heart and the non-beating heart and the prognosis
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure is evaluated: by ShearWave elastography with the measurement of Young modulus on non-beating heart by a combined index combining all rehospitalization for heart failure, increase in heart failure treatment and cardiac death

arm_group.description: Coronary bypass patients without hypertrophic left ventricular remodeling or sequelae of myocardial infarction

intervention.description: To measure myocardial stiffness by ShearWave elastography on not beating heart
